_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP Executive Summary

1.0 Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at Bar-S Foods, Lawton Division.

Bar-S Foods, Lawton Division prevents accidental releases through classroom and on the job training of refrigeration personnel and ongoing inspection and maintenance of the refrigeration system. Refrigeration system components are located in areas that are not as likely to become damaged (i.e., tanks and pipe runs are placed away and protected from forklift and truck traffic.). The facility maintains an ongoing emergency action program that prepares for the safe evacuation and timely response by trained personnel. 

2.0 Bar-S Foods, Lawton and Anhydrous Ammonia. 

Bar-S Foods, Lawton processes and freezes meat products for global distribution. Approximately 38,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia is contained within the refrigeration system on site at Bar-S Foods, Lawton. A Risk Management Plan has been developed as required and is maintained in order to reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia from the system. 

3.0 Accidental Release Prevention Program and Prevention Steps. 

Bar-S Foods, Lawton complies with all rules and regulations that pertain to the safe storage and use of anhydrous ammonia. Specific regulations include: OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation; OSHA Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER); OSHA Hazard Communication (HAZCOM); OSHA Employee Emergency Action and Fire Prevention Plans; EPA Risk Management Plan regulations (RMP); IIAR Guidelines.

Specific prevention steps that have been implemented to increase the safety of operation of ammonia refrigeration system include:
- Upgrading operator refresher training.
- Only refrigeration technicians are permitted to operate forklifts inside the engine room. 
- Addition of moisture eliminators to the MP2 program for annual inspections.
- Install liquid rated valves on all oil pots.
- Engine room ammonia sensors connected to activate venti

lation fans.
- Two Acuair units with smoke and ammonia detection are located on roof area.

4.0 Five Year Accident History.

No releases or accidents, involving anhydrous ammonia, that are reportable in accordance with 40 CFR Part 68 (RMP Regulation), have occurred at this facility within the last five (5) years. 

5.0 Bar-S Foods, Lawton Emergency Action/Response Program.

Bar-S Foods, Lawton maintains an ongoing Emergency Action-Response Plan/Program in order to efficiently notify and evacuate employees, notify potential critical receptors in the community and state and local emergency response agencies. The program includes initial and annual training for employees who respond to releases or potential releases.  The program includes written procedures for proper first aid and emergency medical treatment; procedures for notifying agency responders and procedures to review and update the plan and ensure that employees are informed of changes. The facility emergency action-response plan is coordinated with the local fire department as required by the Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act. 

Red Cross shelter resources in the area consist of pre-arranged service agreements with local schools and churches. Facilities that would serve as a Red Cross shelter would have food, cots, and first aid supplies on site and reserve supplies would be shipped in. The fire Department of Police Chief would activate the Red Cross if they are needed and would arrive within two hours with the emergency vehicles. They are able to provide first aid, refreshments, and clean clothing for emergency response workers. The Fire or Police Chief would decide if sheltering-in-place, evacuation, sheltering off-site is required in a given emergency. If evacuation were needed, the Red Cross would activate the shelter(s) determined to be located at a safe distance from the hot area. Those in need of medical attention would be taken to a nearby hospital. 

6.0 Planned Changes to Improve S

afety at Bar-S Foods, Lawton Division.

Future plans to improve anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system safety at Bar-S Foods, Lawton include:
- Annual coordination of the emergency action/response plan with the Fire Department.
- Annual First Responder Operations Level (8 hour) HAZWOPER training/refreshers.
- Improving PSM elements on and ongoing basis.
- Ongoing RETA training for refrigeration technicians.
- Perform NDT on all covered process piping and high pressure receiver. 
- Install additional Acuair units for "wet-end" on roof area with smoke and ammonia detection system which will shutdown units.
- Upgrade auto-purge inside the engine room.
